intro: Sloanea emeiensis, commonly known as the Emei Mountain Sloanea, is a rare evergreen tree native to China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elongated leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high elevations. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has limited commercial use. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a vulnerable species.
